title: 111_hr5156
content: The Act titled "Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Act of 2010" establishes a fund for clean energy technology manufacturing and export assistance. The Act establishes a fund for clean energy technology manufacturing and export assistance. Clean energy technology refers to technologies that reduce energy-related emissions and improve energy efficiency or diversify energy sources for increased security. The Secretary of Commerce shall establish a Clean Energy Technology Manufacturing and Export Assistance Fund to promote policies that reduce production costs, encourage innovation, and implement a national clean energy technology export strategy. The Fund aims to support US clean energy technology firms and create jobs in the sector. The Secretary of Commerce will provide assistance to US businesses in the clean energy technology sector to promote manufacturing and export of clean energy products. This includes developing policies to reduce costs and promote innovation, educating companies on market-specific activities, facilitating the export process, and helping companies navigate foreign markets. The Secretary of Commerce will assist US companies in the clean energy technology sector by helping them navigate foreign markets and provide input on clean energy technology manufacturing and trade policy. A report will be submitted to Congress within 180 days outlining how funds will be used to focus on small and medium-sized businesses, create clean energy technology jobs, and promote domestic production of clean energy products and services. The Secretary of Commerce will report to Congress by January 1, 2015, on the success of the program in developing policies to reduce costs and promote innovation in clean energy technology. The report will also assess the program's impact on increasing the competitiveness of US clean energy firms in emerging markets and assisting small and medium-sized businesses. The program has been successful in creating jobs in the clean energy technology sector in the United States and assisting businesses with exporting clean energy technology products and services. It has also helped US companies provide input on clean energy technology manufacturing and trade policy developments. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the program. Authorized appropriations of $15,000,000 annually from 2011 to 2015 for the Secretary to implement the program, with a limitation that assistance cannot be in the form of monetary grants. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 28, 2010. Attest: LORRAINE C. MILLER, Clerk.
